summary: This bill, the "Cost Recovery and Expensing Acceleration to Transform the Economy and Jumpstart Opportunities for Businesses and Startups Act" (CREATE JOBS Act), amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Key provisions include permanently allowing full expensing for qualified property, adjusting depreciation for residential and nonresidential real property, and eliminating the amortization of research and experimental expenditures. These changes aim to stimulate economic activity through tax incentives and adjustments to depreciation rules.
